title: This “Gorgeous” $14 Frame Looks 10x the Price (Shoppers Are Buying 3 at a Time!)
description: Finally hang your art without breaking the bank. READ MORE...
author: Jada Wong
excerpt: Finally hang your art without breaking the bank.
text: DecoratingDecor & AccessoriesShoppingWe independently select these products—if you buy from one of our links, we may earn a commission. All prices were accurate at the time of publishing.1 / 10Amazon$14.99If you know exactly what you’re looking for, chances are that Amazon is likely to have it in just the right size, material, color, and price. Like this gold easel-style frame, which Senior Editor Blair Donovan bought to honor her great-grandparents. Plus, you’ll be able to get your frame within two days.2 / 10Walmart$9.98was $13.74This gold tabletop frame at Walmart is one of the most popular frames at the retailer, and it’s obvious to see why. The vintage-inspired frame is gorgeous, and the $10 sale price means it’s the perfect little luxury — especially for gifting.3 / 10West Elm$35.00These classic gallery frames from West Elm come in more than half a dozen sizes, as well as frame finishes and materials, like white wood, brass, and metal.4 / 10Anthropologie$16.80was $24.00We’ll always have Paris … and this Parisian-inspired bistro tile frame from Anthropologie. It comes in an itty-bitty 4x4-inch size, as well as a larger 4x6-inch, though at these sale prices, you could probably grab both and still stay within budget.6 / 10Marshalls$19.99Save yourself a trip to Marshalls and shop at their impressive online shop instead. That’s where I found this $20 gem — a vintage-inspired tabletop frame that folds and holds three photos (4x6 inches on the sides, and 5x7 inches in the center). The frame would look great on a table but would also hold its own mounted on a wall.7 / 10Target$14.00Target runs should include a walk through their frame offerings, especially ones from its in-house Threshold line. This arched frame is a modern take on the classic gallery frame and would look great on a console table or nightstand.8 / 10Wayfair$25.99was $30.99Online home retailer Wayfair has a wide selection of inexpensive and stylish hanging frames, and many are often on sale, like this large 11x14-inch wooden frame. On sale for just $25.99 and available in five finishes, it’s a hard deal to beat.9 / 10Crate & Barrel$44.95Crate & Barrel’s triple photo frames are a pretty good value, considering that you’re able to frame three photos for under $45. Depending on your budget, you can size up the frame, but this 4x6-inch frame is super versatile for a table or a wall.10 / 10Urban Outfitters$20.00Lifestyle retailer Urban Outfitters doesn't have a huge variety of hanging frames, but the ones they do have are super unique, like this colorful checkered frame that’s sized perfectly for vinyl album covers.
html:
• Decorating
  • Decor & Accessories
  • Shopping

We independently select these products—if you buy from one of our links, we may earn a commission. All prices were accurate at the time of publishing.

1 / 10

Amazon

$14.99

If you know exactly what you’re looking for, chances are that Amazon is likely to have it in just the right size, material, color, and price. Like this gold easel-style frame, which Senior Editor Blair Donovan bought to honor her great-grandparents. Plus, you’ll be able to get your frame within two days.

2 / 10

Walmart

$9.98

was $13.74

This gold tabletop frame at Walmart is one of the most popular frames at the retailer, and it’s obvious to see why. The vintage-inspired frame is gorgeous, and the $10 sale price means it’s the perfect little luxury — especially for gifting.

3 / 10

West Elm

$35.00

These classic gallery frames from West Elm come in more than half a dozen sizes, as well as frame finishes and materials, like white wood, brass, and metal.

4 / 10

Anthropologie

$16.80

was $24.00

We’ll always have Paris … and this Parisian-inspired bistro tile frame from Anthropologie. It comes in an itty-bitty 4x4-inch size, as well as a larger 4x6-inch, though at these sale prices, you could probably grab both and still stay within budget.

6 / 10

Marshalls

$19.99

Save yourself a trip to Marshalls and shop at their impressive online shop instead. That’s where I found this $20 gem — a vintage-inspired tabletop frame that folds and holds three photos (4x6 inches on the sides, and 5x7 inches in the center). The frame would look great on a table but would also hold its own mounted on a wall.

7 / 10

Target

$14.00

Target runs should include a walk through their frame offerings, especially ones from its in-house Threshold line. This arched frame is a modern take on the classic gallery frame and would look great on a console table or nightstand.

8 / 10

Wayfair

$25.99

was $30.99

Online home retailer Wayfair has a wide selection of inexpensive and stylish hanging frames, and many are often on sale, like this large 11x14-inch wooden frame. On sale for just $25.99 and available in five finishes, it’s a hard deal to beat.

9 / 10

Crate & Barrel

$44.95

Crate & Barrel’s triple photo frames are a pretty good value, considering that you’re able to frame three photos for under $45. Depending on your budget, you can size up the frame, but this 4x6-inch frame is super versatile for a table or a wall.

10 / 10

Urban Outfitters

$20.00

Lifestyle retailer Urban Outfitters doesn't have a huge variety of hanging frames, but the ones they do have are super unique, like this colorful checkered frame that’s sized perfectly for vinyl album covers.
